<div class="lesson-card">
  <p>Skin cells are frequently left behind through touch and can serve as trace evidence in forensic investigations.</p> 

  <p>Even small amounts, known as "touch DNA," can provide genetic material for identification, helping link a suspect or victim to objects, locations, or other individuals involved in a case.</p>
